member.name: F:Aequus.Common.ModPlayers.AequusPlayer.itemCooldownMax
member.summary: When a new cooldown is applied, this gets set to the duration of the cooldown. Does not tick down unlike

member.name: F:Aequus.Common.ModPlayers.AequusPlayer.itemCooldown
member.summary: When above 0, the cooldown is active. Ticks down by 1 every player update.

member.name: F:Aequus.Common.ModPlayers.AequusPlayer.itemCombo
member.summary:
When above 0, you are in a combo. Ticks down by 1 every player update.
Item "combos" are used for determining what type of item action to use.
A usage example would be a weapon with a 3 swing pattern. Each swing will increase the combo meter by 60, and when it becomes greater than 120, reset to 0.

member.name: F:Aequus.Common.ModPlayers.AequusPlayer.itemUsage
member.summary: Increments when the player uses an item. Does not increment when the player is using the alt function of an item.

member.name: F:Aequus.Common.ModPlayers.AequusPlayer.itemSwitch
member.summary: A short lived timer which gets set to 30 when the player has a different selected item.

member.name: F:Aequus.Common.ModPlayers.AequusPlayer.netInteractionCooldown
member.summary: Used to prevent players from spam interacting with special objects which may have important networking actions which need to be awaited. Ticks down by 1 every player update.

member.summary:
Adds a NecroStats data for an npc index in
Parameter 1: NPC Type (short)
Parameter 2: Tier (float), is tier 1, is tier 4
Parameter 3 (Optional): View range (float), how close a slave needs to be to an enemy in order for it to target it. Defaults to 800
Please handle these mod calls in . As buff immunities are setup in
member.returns: 'Success' when correctly handled. 'Failure' when improperly handled

member.summary: Whether or not the camera is returning

member.name: M:Aequus.Graphics.CameraFocus.SetTarget(System.String,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Aequus.Graphics.CameraPriority,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the camera target to a position, may return false if your priority is below a current target's priority
member.param: Context key, only really useful for 3rd party mods
A world coordinate to point the camera at
The priority of this camera target. If there is a current camera target, and its priority is above, it will prevent you from setting a target and this method will return false
The speed of the camera, the exact time it will get there is: speed / 50So 6 speed means it will get into position in 8 frames. Clamped between 6 and 25
How long the camera holds in its target position after the caller stops running
member.returns: Whether or not the camera target has been set to a new position. Spamming SetTarget will only return true on the first SetTarget call, and the rest will return false
